title: ‘Shameless’ Donald Trump selects his own country club as site for next year’s G-7 summit
text:
President Donald Trump arrives to board Air Force One at Andrews Air Force Base on Thursday, shortly before he was branded ‘shameless’ and ‘corrupt’ for choosing one of his own luxury resorts to host next year’s G-7 summit of world leaders (Picture: EPA)

Donald Trump was branded ‘shameless’ and ‘corrupt’ after choosing one of his own luxury resorts to host next year’s G-7 summit.

The White House announced Thursday that the June 2020 gathering of world leaders will happen at the Trump National Doral Miami Resort in Florida.

Acting Chief of Staff Mick Mulvaney claimed Doral had been chosen out of 10 other possible properties – with the shortlist also including Trump’s Mar-a-Lago county club in West Palm Beach.

Trump, his fellow presidents and prime ministers are all likely to stay at the luxury resort with their entourages, spending millions on accommodation and hospitality, while also generating considerable free publicity for the property.

Mulvaney claimed the president ‘was not making any profit’ and had chosen to host the summit ‘at cost’ (price).

Next year’s G-7 will be held at the Trump National Doral resort in Miami, Florida, with world leaders and their entourages likely to spend millions there on accommodation and hospitality (Picture: Getty)

He said Doral had been chosen based on criteria including its ballrooms and accommodations, as well as proximity to airports, helicopter landing sites, cities, medical facilities.

He insisted the US would actually save money from hosting the event there over other unnamed shortlisted sites in California, Colorado, North Carolina, Florida, Hawaii, Michigan, Tennessee and Utah.

But Mulvaney refused to say exactly how much the event would cost.

The president chose Doral despite a key 2016 election promise to drain the so-called Washington DC ‘swamp’ of corrupt politicians interested in furthering their own interests and lining their own pockets.

Longtime Trump critic George Conway, whose wife Kellyanne is one of the president’s top aides, quickly tweeted that the decision was ‘utterly shameless.’

Acting White House Chief of Staff Mick Mulvaney is pictured announcing plans to hold next year’s G-7 summit of world leaders at the Trump National Doral resort in Miami, Florida (Picture: EPA)

Conway added: ‘This is so corrupt… Clearly they conducted a careful review and found that the Doral was the best Trump property at which to hold this event.’

Questioned further about whether choosing Doral was a ‘huge conflict of interest,’ Mulvaney again insisted the president would not make any money from the event.

He told reporters: ‘The president has made it very clear that he doesn’t profit from being here. He has no interest in profit from being here..

‘Donald Trump’s brand is probably strong enough as it is and he doesn’t need any more help on that.’

Mulvaney also took a swipe at 2020 Democratic presidential hopeful Joe Biden, whose son Hunter has been forced to deny he is corrupt over links to a Ukrainian natural gas firm.

He said: ‘There’s no profit here, there’s clearly profit with the Bidens.’

But The Washington Post says Trump’s clubs have made at least $1.6million in revenue from his visits there since becoming president, with federal officials and Republican campaigners made to pay for accommodation there.

Holding the G-7 at Doral will dwarf any other official event previously held at one of the property developer turned reality TV star turned leader of the free world’s properties.

It will see Trump and his team meet with leaders of the world’s seven largest advanced economies – France, Japan, Canada, Italy, Germany and the United Kingdom.

The G-7 sees nations share their economic initiatives in a bid to guarantee continued prosperity for their home nations and the wider world.

The chief of staff claimed said that Doral had been chosen after it was ruled ‘far and away the best physical facility for this meeting.’

He even claimed that organizers ‘said…it’s almost like they built this facility to host this type of event.’

Rumors of Trump’s plan to host the 2020 G-7 at Doral first emerged in June, amid claims his aides were trying to talk him out of the decision for fear of how it would look.
description: The President of the United States sparked incredulity after his spokesman claimed he wouldn't make any money from holding the huge event at one of his own properties
